alert.note: Alert for Yuma (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued December 02 at 2:53PM MST until December 02 at 4:45PM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Yuma County in northeastern Colorado... * Until 445 PM MST. * At 250 PM MST, several plumes of dust were observed along the Yuma and Washington county border. While the plumes are remaining stationary, blowing dust will continue to expand in coverage downwind of these areas. Visibilities will change rapidly over short distances. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 65 mph. SOURCE...Satellite Imagery. IMPACT...Hazardous travel and poor air quality. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 208 and 210, and between mile markers 212 and 269. Locations impacted include... Yuma, Wray, Bonny Reservoir, Eckley, Abarr, Beecher Island and Wauneta. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
